name: Scrappin
desc: Due to their love for battle, orks will begin fighting even harder as their ship takes damage.

name: Degraded Targeting Core
desc:
Salvaged from the corpse of a paragon, this targeting core has lost it's peak abilities, but is nonetheless very powerful.

Extends the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s. The range of point-defense weapons is only extended by %s.

Precludes the installation of a Dedicated Targeting Core or an Integrated Targeting Unit.

name: Baltach Construction
desc: Made by the Bultach Coalition to last many battles, their ships are exceptionally easy to recover even after being destroyed in combat.
short: Ship almost always recoverable if lost.

name: Low Maintenance
desc: Decreases the monthly maintenance supply cost by %s.

name: Shockwave Negating Armor
desc: An expensive, thorough upgrade to the ship's armor in order to let it better resist explosions or impacts of particularly massive size. Often used when facing targets using doomsday weapons, as it offers no other benefits whatsoever.
short: Massively decreases damage above a threshold of 4000

name: Extensive Missile Racks
desc: Due to this salvage sporeship's vast hull, a massive amount of missiles can be stored. Increases the ammo capacity of missile weapons by %s.

name: Massive Hull
desc: An expensive, thorough upgrade to the ship's armor in order to let it better resist explosions or impacts of particularly massive size. Often used when facing targets using doomsday weapons, as it offers no other benefits whatsoever. Reduces damage above a threshold of 4500 by 70%

name: EMP Resistant Plating
desc: Decreases the amount of damage taken from EMP weapons (such as Ion Cannons) by %s.

name: Semi-automated Ship
desc:
This ship is semi-automated, only capable of taking on a small crew for maintenance and safety purposes.

Semi-automated ships require specialized equipment and expertise to maintain, resulting in a maximum combat readiness penalty of %s.

name: Linked Hull
desc: Mirrors certain aspects between the parent and child hulls.

name: HULLMOD CONFLICT
desc: %s, the hullmod you tried to install conflicts with this hull or another previously installed hullmod.
short: %s, the hullmod you tried to install conflicts with this hull or another previously installed hullmod.
